block.p: BEGUN in 1829 as a Sunday School festival, Anniversary Day (or Brooklyn Day) was transformed into a celebration of the founding of Brooklyn, and in 1959 the Board of Education extended the holiday to Queens. The holiday is usually celebrated the second Thursday in June. The celebrants pictured above are from a 1910 photograph by J. J. Levison, from the Prospect Park Alliance archives, that is part of the show ''A Park for All People.''

One hundred historical and contemporary photographs are on display at Grand Army Plaza and the Brooklyn Public Library. You can share your own memories at the last of three ''Photo Days,'' at which experts offer historical interpretation of pictures taken before 1960, on Saturday from noon to 3 p.m. on the steps of the Central Library.
